rev.diff:
Line 40: Line 40:
On May 19, 2011, information was leaked on various websites of a possible June 4 release date for the phone. The leak appeared to originate from an internal [[Radio Shack]] email.
On May 19, 2011, information was leaked on various websites of a possible June 4 release date for the phone. The leak appeared to originate from an internal [[Radio Shack]] email.
â
On May 24, 2011, it was confirmed that the Evo 3D has been locked down with a cryptographically signed bootloader, recovery, and kernel image - thereby most likely foreclosing custom roms such as Cyanogenmod. On May 24, 2011 HTC released a statement via Facebook, saying that they are reviewing their bootloader policy. On May 26, 2011 Peter Chou, the CEO of HTC, announced on Facebook that "we will no longer be locking the bootloaders on our devices." <ref name='HTC bootloader unlocking'>{{cite web | url = http://www.facebook.com/HTC/posts/10150307320018084 | title = There has been... | accessdate = 2011-05-28 | last = Chou | first = Peter | date = 2011-05-26}}</ref>
+
On May 24, 2011, it was confirmed that the Evo 3D has been locked down with a cryptographically signed bootloader, recovery, and kernel image - thereby most likely foreclosing custom roms such as [[CyanogenMod]]. On May 24, 2011 HTC released a statement via Facebook, saying that they are reviewing their bootloader policy. On May 26, 2011 Peter Chou, the CEO of HTC, announced on Facebook that "we will no longer be locking the bootloaders on our devices." <ref name='HTC bootloader unlocking'>{{cite web | url = http://www.facebook.com/HTC/posts/10150307320018084 | title = There has been... | accessdate = 2011-05-28 | last = Chou | first = Peter | date = 2011-05-26}}</ref>
A Radio Shack ad leaked the price for the Evo 3D at US$199.99 with 2-year contract and $499.99 without contract, with a trade in credit on the [[HTC Evo 4G]] or Evo Shift of $100.
A Radio Shack ad leaked the price for the Evo 3D at US$199.99 with 2-year contract and $499.99 without contract, with a trade in credit on the [[HTC Evo 4G]] or Evo Shift of $100.
